revised_title: Large Molecules from Dietary Protein Enter the Brain
tldr: The study investigates the entry of large molecules derived from dietary protein into the brain. The researchers found that significant amounts of protein-bound radioactivity were present in brain extracts, suggesting that the brain is permeated with protein derivatives from the fed material. This discovery challenges the traditional belief that proteins like IgG do not traverse the blood-brain barrier.
